detaileddescription.para: Check if the character is a special symbol.

simplesect.para: true if the character is '', '-', '+', or '!', false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Modifies the given mods variable based on the input character.

parameterdescription.para: the character input to determine the modification
the variable to be modified based on the input character

detaileddescription.para: Check if the given name meets certain criteria and is not already in use.

parameterdescription.para: A list of modules to compare the name against

simplesect.para: 0 if the name is valid and not in use, 1 if the name not starts with '_', 2 if the name contains invalid characters, 3 if the name is already in use

detaileddescription.para: Checks if the input string contains at least one of each lowercase letter up to the "biggest" letter in use. And not contains syntactic error.

simplesect.para: 2 if wrong format, 1 if wrong character usage, 0 if it's valid

detaileddescription.para: Checks if the input string contains at least one of each lowercase letter up to the "biggest" letter in use and after a specific character every letter used as output.

simplesect.para: 1 if a letter used as an output more than once, 2 if it's not valid, 0 if it's valid

detaileddescription.para: A function that checks the wiring connections of uppercase letters in the input string.

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the input string to be checked

simplesect.para: 0 if the wiring connections are correct, 1 if a letter used as an output more than once, 2 if there are incorrect wiring connections

detaileddescription.para: Function to check and validate modules based on input string.

parameterdescription.para: The input string to check against modules.
A list of modules to compare against the input string.

simplesect.para: 0 if successful, 1 if module does not exist, 2 if wrong input number, 3 if wrong output number.

detaileddescription.para: Function to test a module with the given name and commands.

parameterdescription.para: the name and commands of the module to be tested
a list of module pointers to be tested against
flag to indicate whether to add the module

detaileddescription.para: A template function to handle different types of input characters and modify state accordingly.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to an array of uint8_t to store inputs
a reference to a template type T representing the current state
a reference to a uint8_t to store modifiers
a reference to a size_t to store a number

simplesect.para: true if the input character is processed successfully, false otherwise

parameterdescription.para: a list of wire_t pointers to wires, waiting to be processed

simplesect.para: true if the function execution is successful, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Recursively reads characters from the input stream and stores them in a dynamically allocated char array.

parameterdescription.para: the input stream to read from
the current size of the char array being built

simplesect.para: a dynamically allocated char array containing the characters read from the input stream

detaileddescription.para: A function that prints error messages based on the error code passed in.

parameterdescription.para: the error code to determine which error message to print

simplesect.para: true if error code is 0, false otherwise

detaileddescription.para: Prints the contents of the module to the console in a formatted manner.

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the module to be printed
flag indicating whether to include the beginning formatting
flag indicating whether to include the ending formatting
